Theoretical Background

This section provides an overview of Cosmic Loom Theory’s theoretical foundations.

For the complete theoretical documents, see the source files in docs/theory/.

Core Framework: CLT v1.1

Cosmic Loom Theory v1.1 focuses on human biological consciousness, treating it not as a localized neural phenomenon but as a system-level property arising from integrated field dynamics.

The Loomfield

The Loomfield (L) is an effective field description capturing coherence-relevant structure in biological systems. It is not a new fundamental force, but an emergent description of how multiple biological substrates coordinate.

The Loomfield evolves according to:

\[\nabla^2 L - \frac{1}{v_L^2} \frac{\partial^2 L}{\partial t^2} = \kappa_L \cdot \rho_{coh}\]

Where:

  • \(v_L\) = Loomfield propagation speed

  • \(\kappa_L\) = Coupling constant

  • \(\rho_{coh}\) = Coherence density (source term)

Energy Resistance

The Energy Resistance (éR) principle defines where coherent dynamics can exist:

\[\acute{e}R = \frac{EP}{f^2}\]

Three regimes:

  1. Chaos Regime (low éR): High frequency relative to energy creates decoherence

  2. Viable Window (moderate éR): Optimal for coherent biological organization

  3. Rigidity Regime (high éR): Too much energy relative to dynamics creates frozen states

Consciousness Observable

The consciousness observable (C_bio) quantifies the “amount” of consciousness:

\[C_{bio} = Q^n \times \int |\rho_{coh}| \cdot \left|\frac{\partial L}{\partial t}\right| dV\]

Where:

  • Q = Coherence metric (spatial organization)

  • n = 2 for 2D, 3 for 3D (stronger penalty in higher dimensions)

  • The integral measures coupled activity

Consciousness requires both coherence (Q) AND activity. Pure coherence without dynamics (frozen) or pure activity without coherence (chaos) both yield low C_bio.

Biological Substrates

CLT identifies four complementary mechanisms supporting Loomfield integration:

  1. Bioelectric Fields - Morphogenetic gradients (Levin lab research)

  2. Biophotons - Ultra-weak photon emission (Murugan lab research)

  3. Cytoskeletal Structure - Microtubule dynamics (Penrose-Hameroff extended)

  4. Genetic Constraints - DNA as coherence boundary conditions

Related Theoretical Documents

The docs/theory/ folder contains:

  • CLT v1.1 - Core framework for human biological consciousness

  • CLT v2.0 - Planetary-scale extensions

  • Introducing CLT - Overview and motivation

  • Machines & AI - Artificial system coherence analysis

  • LoomSense specs - Experimental measurement platform (v1-v3)

Connections to Other Theories

CLT synthesizes insights from:

  • Integrated Information Theory (IIT) - Φ as a coherence measure

  • Global Workspace Theory - Broadcasting as field propagation

  • Predictive Processing - Prediction errors as coherence perturbations

  • Quantum Biology - Coherence at biological scales

Unlike purely philosophical or quantum-mystical approaches, CLT maintains compatibility with established physics while proposing testable mechanisms.
